continent.title: Water, source of inequality
continent.subtitle: Almost half the African population did not have access to clean water.
continent.content: Africa has adequate water resources, but the distribution is uneven. Known as the poorest continent in the world, many of its states are struggling to find a political balance. The issue of water is all the more important in these countries as their populations struggle to survive.

continent.subtitle: When the thirst is more unbearable than hunger
continent.content: The country experienced quite serious difficulties in treating drinking water. The system set up is obsolete and does not allow reaching the affected deep areas and therefore the populations.

continent.content: The pirate networks had control over the distribution of water in Cote d'Ivoire. The water had become a golden eggs, and its access impossible. Thus, thousands of families had to resort to the clandestine distribution to refuel.
